title: Given Probabilities
text: When we see the notation P(D|C), this is essentially asking us "What is the probability that D happens, given that C already happened?".
speech: When we see the notation P(D|C), this is essentially asking us "What is the probability that D happens, given that C already happened?".
pacedSpeech: When we see the notation P(D|C), this is essentially asking us "What is the probability that D happens, given that C already happened?".

title: Given Probabilities
text: We can find P(D|C) through this formula: P(D|C) $$=$$ P(D and C)/P(C).
speech: We can find P(D|C) through this formula: P(D|C)  is equal to  P(D and C)/P(C).
